snippet: Monday was the 14th day since Hurricane Sandy upended lives on the Eastern Seaboard, the longest two weeks of many people’s lives.
abstract: Many people in New York City and New Jersey are still struggling with lack of housing or heat fourteen days after Hurricane Sandy swept through Eastern seaboard; despite ongoing recovery efforts, scores of residents describe scenes of hardship and misery.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ruth Bashinsky, Russ Buettner, Stephen Farrell, David M. Halbfinger and Sarah Maslin Nir.

lead_paragraph: Monday was the 14th day since Hurricane Sandy upended lives on the Eastern Seaboard, the longest two weeks of many people’s lives.

headline.seo: Pockets of Misery Persist 2 Weeks After Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: Cold, Dark and Damp, Pockets of Misery Persist 2 Weeks Later
headline.print_headline: Cold, Dark and Damp, Pockets of Misery Persist 2 Weeks Later
